definition: lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident

sentences.english: The sheep started to run amok and the kids too.
sentences.chinese: 羊儿们开始横冲直撞，孩子们也如此一片混乱。

sentences.english: When someone drives a perfect car in an improper manner, no one blames the car…
sentences.chinese: 一个人开着名车横冲直撞，没有人会说车的不对。

sentences.english: He barged his way through the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他横冲直撞地穿过人群。

sentences.english: Suddenly, dizzy, flying sand and rolling pebbles, rampage.
sentences.chinese: 刹那间，天旋地转，飞沙走石，横冲直撞。

sentences.english: The mail-cart of a flying travel is on highway dash around madly.
sentences.chinese: 一辆飞速行驶的邮车在公路上横冲直撞。

sentences.english: The mob rampaged through the village.
sentences.chinese: 这伙暴徒在村中横冲直撞。

sentences.english: People drive crazy in this city.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市的人们开车都横冲直撞的。

sentences.english: The dog ran through the church and caused quite a commotion.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗在教会横冲直撞，大家一时惊慌失措。

sentences.english: The elephants rampaged through the forest .
sentences.chinese: 象群横冲直撞地穿过森林。

sentences.english: The maniac ran amuck in the crowd, shooting at random.
sentences.chinese: 这个疯子在人群里横冲直撞，胡乱开枪。

sentences.english: The elephant smashed through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 大象在树林中横冲直撞。

sentences.english: Gangs of youths went on the rampage in the city yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 成群结伙的年轻人昨天在城里横冲直撞。

sentences.english: I get so upset when I see bad driving.
sentences.chinese: 我看到人们横冲直撞地开车时真的很心烦。

sentences.english: The driver lost control and the car careen down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 因司机失控，那辆汽车就横冲直撞地冲下山去。

sentences.english: Jack is always careering about and breaking things.
sentences.chinese: 杰克总是横冲直撞，打破东西。

sentences.english: They had the bit in their teeth and they moved fast.
sentences.chinese: 他们有如脱经的烈马，横冲直撞，迅猛异常。

definition: to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
lit. to squeeze into every crack (idiom)/fig. to make the most of every opportunity
to whistle past/to hurtle past/to zip by
